net.engio.blox.reader.events

Class CsvEvent

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.engio.blox.reader.events.CsvEvent

  • public class CsvEvent
extends Object
    An instance of CsvEvent is created by the BloxReader for each line of a given source that represents relevant data. The event is passed to the corresponding handler registered in the block metamodel. The source line and parsed data are accessible and modifiable through the event. Modifying the data in the event will affect all succeeding handlers (as they all see the same event). Thus, it is possible to define atomic data modifications in form of handlers and combine different handlers to achieve more complex tasks. For example: One handler can remove the first column, the second replaces some placeholders, the third stores the data in the database.
    Author:
    Benjamin Diedrichsen
